subject: Re: [junit] Categories in JUnit4?
msgSnippet: ... Touche. In fact, I /do/ address that situation. Best way block kick--no be there. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info Your guide to
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> On 11/25/05, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
> >
> > > For example, a test could be "performance", "integration" and
> "database"
> > at
> > > the same time.
> >
> > I find that if I really need to run all performance tests, or all
> > integration tests, or all database tests, then I /really/ need to run
> > /all/ the tests, so I simply run them all.
>
> Sure, but you're not addressing the point I raise above (maybe because it
> can't be addressed with your approach? ;-)).

Touche. In fact, I /do/ address that situation. "Best way block kick--no
be there."
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
